Nassim Nicholas Taleb

We all know he is Lebanese, but It’s impossible to not mention him in this list, due to his big achievements and thanks to him people can understand more the cultural diversity within the Lebanese society, that was out-shadowed by Arabism & its advocates.

Nassim Nicholas is an essayist, scholar, statistician, and former trader and risk analyst, whose work concerns problems of randomness, probability, and uncertainty. His 2007 book The Black Swan has been described by The Sunday Times as one of the twelve most influential books since World War II.

In 2009, he was included on the Forbes magazine list of “Most Influential Management Gurus”. In 2011, he was included on the Bloomberg 50 most influential people in global finance, and in 2013, 2014, 2015 he was included among most influential 100 thought leaders in the world by the Gottlieb Duttweiler Institute.

Ralph Nader

Ralph Nader, born February 27, 1934, is an American political activist, author, lecturer, and attorney. The son of Lebanese immigrants to the United States. Nader also ran for president of the United States.

Shannon Elizabeth

The American pie star, born September 7, 1973, Texas. She is an American actress and former fashion model, and a proud Lebanese, as she stated: “I’m proud of the Lebanese side of my life” “I remember going to my grandparents’ house quite a bit and it was always about cooking and Lebanese food”. Shannon starred in Chris Brown’s song and in movies such as:

American Pie

Scary movie

Night of the demons

Rima Fakih

Rima Fakih, born September 22, 1985, is a Lebanese-American actress, model, professional wrestler and beauty pageant titleholder who won Miss USA 2010. She represented the state of Michigan in the national pageant. Rima was born in Lebanon, and left to the US at the age of 8.

Jenna Dewan

The dime that Channing Tatum lost, after about 9 years of marriage. Dewan was born in Hartford, born December 3, 1980, She is an American actress and dancer. The daughter of Nancy Smith and Darrell Dewan, of Lebanese and Polish descent, (Dewan being a surname of middle-eastern origin).

Tony Shalhoub

He has also had a successful film career other than the series “Monk” such as

Barton Fink

Big Night

Men in Black

The Siege

Galaxy Quest

Spy Kids

The Man Who Wasn’t There

Cars

1408

Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles

Catherine and Elizabeth keener

She has been twice nominated for the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress for her roles as Maxine Lund in Being John Malkovich and Harper Lee in Capote.

Amal Clooney

Amal Alamuddin Clooney, born 3 February 1978, in Chouf, is a Druze Lebanese-British specializing in international law and human rights. Her clients include Julian Assange, the founder of WikiLeaks, in his fight against extradition. She has also represented the former PM of Ukraine, Yulia Tymoshenko, and Egyptian-Canadian journalist Mohamed Fahmy. She is married to the American actor George Clooney.

William Hanna and Joseph Barbera

Awarded 7 Oscars, Joseph Barbera and William Hanna (creators of Tom and Jerry), are of Lebanese origins. Some sources claim Barbera is of Italian origins, others claim of Lebanese origins.

Noah Shebib

Ever since So Far Gone, Shebib has been producing almost all of Drizzy’s music and has also taken on producing for other artists such as Lil Wayne, Alicia Keys, and Majid Jordan among several others.

Noah said in an interview when asked about his nickname “Goldstein”: “My name, 40, this nickname I got, it was cool to say. It was a tough one, and my name is awesome ironically enough, though I’m Lebanese, not Israeli. It was a cool name to say. Quick, easy, cool thing to say. And really as far as Drake shouting me out all the time, it was just me and him.” https://www.gq.com/story/noah-shebib-40-drake-take-care-producer

Oliver El-Khatib

Oliver creates the balance in OVO. He is the one that pilots the team, makes sure that everything is in order and that it functions as it should. Moreover, Oliver is also in charge of the OVO clothing line and monitors its growth. Earlier on, before handling the clothing line, he used to be known for his visibility on OVO’s blog spot.

Years into his career, El-Khatib has discovered many note-worthy talents such as TheWeeknd and PartyNextDoor.

Tony Sal

He got married to the Lebanese miss USA, Rima Fakih on 15 May 2016 in the Maronite Patriarchal Church in Bkerke, Lebanon, in a marriage ceremony presided by Maronite Patriarch Bechara Boutros al-Rahi in the presence of many celebrities, let along The Weeknd singing at their wedding.

René Angélil

William Peter Blatty

Best Picture (Golden Globes), Best Screenplay (Golden Globes), and Best Adapted Screenplay (Academy Awards)

Margit Saad

Margit is the daughter of a Lebanese linguist father

She made her screen debut in Eva erbt das Paradies. In 1960 she starred in the British drama film “The Criminal” and followed it up with appearances in other British films and television programmes such as The Rebel (US Call Me Genius, 1961),

Playback (1962),

the Edgar Wallace Mysteries series of second features,

The Saint in The Saint Sees It Through (1964)

The Magnificent Two (1967)

Carlos Slim Helú

From 2010 to 2013, Slim was ranked as the richest person in the world by the Forbes business magazine. As of August 2018, he is the 7th-richest person in the world according to Forbes’ listing of The World’s Billionaires with a net worth estimated at $67.4 billion. He is the richest man in Mexico.

Did you know that Mario Kassar, the producer of Rambo, The Terminator, and basic instinct is Lebanese? Rony Saikaly the NBA Player, General John AbiZaid Head of the US Army’s Central command, Charles Elachi director of NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory, Paul Anka, Mika, Joe Hachem and Joseph Mouawad the International Poker players, Michael Debakey the first heart surgeon, Reem Acra, Cyril Tabet, Casey Kasem, Nicholas Skaf, Elie Saab, Zuhair Murad, Carlos Ghosn, Brazil’s former president Michel Temer, Emilio Chuayffet, Kevin O’Leary the Star of America’s Shark Tank, and let’s not forget Gibran Khalil Gibran are also all Lebanese descendants
